body: SIGKILL is currently sent when a test process is stopped, but this can't be routed to remote processes spawned from the original one.

comment_data.body:
Add a comment indicating why softKill should be preferred. 
Your comment for this CL is about the right level of granularity.
`SIGKILL is currently sent when a test process is stopped, but this can't be routed to remote processes spawned from the original one.`
Can we verify whether we were able to kill the process and fail if we weren't able to?

`UnixProcessManager.sendSigIntToProcessTree` will log a warning message and return false if the process isn't killed - what's a reasonable action to take if that's the case? Throw an exception or call `super.doDestroyProcess`?
Lets kill the process completely but also log a message to analytics so we can diagnose what went wrong.
don't need the full command line string which might identify the user, just the file name.

commit.message: Send SIGINT for bazel test processes
Add comment and log if unable to kill process
Remove command line str logging, may contain private info

repo.description: Flutter makes it easy and fast to build beautiful mobile apps.
repo.name: flutter-intellij

title: Send SIGINT for bazel test processes
